013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
018
019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
022
023/**
024 * Allows configuration of the supported OAuth Flows.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * The OAuthFlows Object allows configuration of the supported OAuth Flows. This object contains the configuration 
028 * for different OAuth 2.0 flows that can be used to secure the API. Each flow type has its own specific configuration 
029 * requirements and use cases.
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
032 * <p>
033 * The OAuthFlows Object is composed of the following fields:
034 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
035 *    <li><c>implicit</c> ({@link OAuthFlow}) - Configuration for the OAuth Implicit flow
036 *    <li><c>password</c> ({@link OAuthFlow}) - Configuration for the OAuth Resource Owner Password flow
037 *    <li><c>clientCredentials</c> ({@link OAuthFlow}) - Configuration for the OAuth Client Credentials flow
038 *    <li><c>authorizationCode</c> ({@link OAuthFlow}) - Configuration for the OAuth Authorization Code flow
039 * </ul>
040 *
041 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
042 * <p class='bcode'>
043 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
044 *    OAuthFlows <jv>x</jv> = <jsm>oauthFlows</jsm>()
045 *       .setAuthorizationCode(<jsm>oauthFlow</jsm>()
046 *          .setAuthorizationUrl(<js>"https://example.com/oauth/authorize"</js>)
047 *          .setTokenUrl(<js>"https://example.com/oauth/token"</js>));
048 *
049 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
050 *    String <jv>json</jv> = Json.<jsm>from</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>);
051 *
052 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
053 *    <jv>json</jv> = <jv>x</jv>.toString();
054 * </p>
055 * <p class='bcode'>
056 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
057 *    {
058 *       <js>"authorizationCode"</js>: {
059 *          <js>"authorizationUrl"</js>: <js>"https://example.com/oauth/authorize"</js>,
060 *          <js>"tokenUrl"</js>: <js>"https://example.com/oauth/token"</js>
061 *       }
062 *    }
063 * </p>
064 *
065 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
066 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#oauth-flows-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; OAuth Flows Object</a>
067 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/oauth2/">OpenAPI OAuth2 Authentication</a>
068 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi-v3</a>
069 * </ul>
070 */
071@FluentSetters
072public class OAuthFlows extends OpenApiElement {
073
074   private OAuthFlow implicit,
075         password,
076         clientCredentials,
077         authorizationCode;
078
079   /**
080    * Default constructor.
081    */
082   public OAuthFlows() {}
083
084   /**
085    * Copy constructor.
086    *
087    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
088    */
089   public OAuthFlows(OAuthFlows copyFrom) {
090      super(copyFrom);
091
092      this.implicit = copyFrom.implicit;
093      this.password = copyFrom.password;
094      this.clientCredentials = copyFrom.clientCredentials;
095      this.authorizationCode = copyFrom.authorizationCode;
096   }
097
098   /**
099    * Make a deep copy of this object.
100    *
101    * @return A deep copy of this object.
102    */
103   public OAuthFlows copy() {
104      return new OAuthFlows(this);
105   }
106
107   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
108   protected OAuthFlows strict() {
109      super.strict();
110      return this;
111   }
112
113   @Override /* GENERATED - do not modify */
114   public OAuthFlows strict(Object value) {
115      super.strict(value);
116      return this;
117   }
118
119   /**

126    */

128      return implicit;
129   }

144      implicit = value;
145      return this;

173      password = value;
174      return this;

234
235   // <FluentSetters>
236
237   // </FluentSetters>
238
239   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
240   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
241      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
242      return switch (property) {
243         case "implicit" -> toType(getImplicit(), type);
244         case "password" -> toType(getPassword(), type);
245         case "clientCredentials" -> toType(getClientCredentials(), type);
246         case "authorizationCode" -> toType(getAuthorizationCode(), type);
247         default -> super.get(property, type);
248      };
249   }
250
251   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
252   public OAuthFlows set(String property, Object value) {
253      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
254      return switch (property) {
255         case "authorizationCode" -> setAuthorizationCode(toType(value, OAuthFlow.class));
256         case "clientCredentials" -> setClientCredentials(toType(value, OAuthFlow.class));
257         case "implicit" -> setImplicit(toType(value, OAuthFlow.class));
258         case "password" -> setPassword(toType(value, OAuthFlow.class));
259         default -> {
260            super.set(property, value);
261            yield this;
262         }
263      };
264   }
265
266   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
267   public Set<String> keySet() {
268      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
269         .addIf(authorizationCode != null, "authorizationCode")
270         .addIf(clientCredentials != null, "clientCredentials")
271         .addIf(implicit != null, "implicit")
272         .addIf(password != null, "password")
273         .build();
274      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
275   }
